Dhaba Ghost Curry

1. Extract milk from raw papaya.
2. Marinate the meat in the papaya milk extract.
3. To this add the potatoes, garlic, green chillies, garam masala, red chilli powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, oil and vinegar.
4. Marinate for about 1 hour.
5. Take 2 jelly moulds and line them with gelatine paper.
6. Grease the gelatine with little oil.
7. After 1 hour add little of the beaten eggs to the meat and portion out equally in two moulds.
8. Place tomato slices on top and pour the remaining beaten eggs.
9. Place the mould in the oven.
10. Cook for about 20 mins. until the egg on top sets well.
11. Remove from the mould alongwith the gelatine paper and serve hot.
Bread Potato Bonda

Boiled potatoes - 1/2 kg
Chopped onions - 1
Green chillis - 4 (chopped)
Coriander leaves - few
Turmeric powder - little
Bread - ten slices
Water - 1/2 liter.
Oil - to fry
Salt - to taste

1. Heat oil in a pan.
2. Fry chopped onions and green chillies
3. Add potato pieces, salt, turmeric powder
4. Fry for 5minutes then turn off the stove and add chopped coriander
5. Make large balls and keep a side
6. Heat oil in pan to fry.
7. Take water in a large plate put bread slice in it
8. Squeeze water by placing the bread slice between the two palms
9. Put the potato round in the centre of the slice and cover it on all the sides
10. Fry them to golden brown in the oil and serve them hot with tomato sauce
Aloo-Green Gram Cutlet

Boiled potatoes - 8
Corn flour - 4 table spoons
Green gram sprouts - 1 cup
Masala - 1 table spoons
Grated ginger - 1 table spoon
Red chili powder - 1/2 table spoon
Salt - to taste
Coriander leaves - few (finely chopped)

1. Mash the potatoes
2. Add green gram sprouts into it.
3. Mix all the remaining ingredients in to the mashed potatoes until they turn into fine dough
4. Place the pan on the stove and pour oil
5. Take small balls of the dough and spread it on the pan.
6. Add oil on the top of the cutlet
7. Place the lid and allow it to cook for 5 minutes (until it turns in to brown color)
8. Cook the other side too
9. The Aloo- green gram cutlet is ready to eat with Tomato Sauce
Chilli Chicken Rolls

Cooked chicken – 1 cup
Onion(chopped) – 1 no
Tomato(small) (chopped) – 1 no
Ginger-garlic paste – 1 tsp
Garam masala – 1 tsp
Tortillas or left over chapathis – A few
Eggs – 2 nos
Salt – As reqd
Chilly powder – As reqd
Oil – As reqd
Onions(chopped) for garnishing
Coriander leaves for garnishing
Lime juice – A dash

1Heat oil in a pan.
2)Fry the chopped onions.
3)Add the ginger garlic paste and fry for 3-4 mins along with a few drops of water.
4)Add the tomatoes and the chicken and fry well.
5)Add garam masala, salt and chilly powder and continue frying.
6)Beat the eggs along with salt in a bowl.
7)Heat 1 tsp of oil in a pan.
8)Add 2 tbsp of the beaten egg and cover it with a tortilla.
9)When the egg gets cooked, flip the tortilla and fill it with a little of the chicken mix.
10)On top of the chicken, you can add a few chopped onions, coriander leaves and a dash of lime.
11)Roll it up.
Fish Tikka Recipe

Fish {Cut into pieces} :500gms
Oil :150gms
Ajwin :1 tbsp
Cream :45ml
Cumin seeds powder :2 tsp
garam masala :1 tbsp
Flour{beasin} :20gms
Lemon Juice :30ml
Mint and coriander chutney :5 tbsp
White pepper powder :1/2 tsp
Onion{choppedin circle} :1 no
Curd/yoghurt :60 gm
Salt to taste
chili powder to taste

1) Mix cream garlic paste, ajwain , chili powder, cumin seeds powder, garam masala, lemon juice, salt, mint or coriander chutney, besan flour in yogurt.
2) Add fish pieces to the above mixture and marinate them for about 3 hours.
3) Heat oil in a pan, fry fish pieces on both sides till golden and crisp.
4) Serve fried fish tikka with chopped onions.
Crispy Deep Fried Spinach Balls

Spinach leaves - 25 to 30
Potatoes - 4 (Boiled and mashed)
Amchur powder - 1½ Tea Spoon
Onion - 1( chopped)
green chillies - 3 (chopped)
ghee - 1 Table Spoon
Salt - to taste
Oil - for deep frying
FOR THE BATTER :
Gram flour - ½ tea cup
Rice flour or plain flour - ½ teacup
chilli powder - ½ Tea Spoon
salt - ½ Tea Spoon
water - 1 tea cup

1. Heat the ghee and sauté the onion for 1 minute.
2. Put the green chillies and sauté again for a few seconds.
3. Put the potatoes, amchur powder and salt. Cool and shape into rolls.
4. Put a small roll of the potato filling in the centre of spinach leaf and wrap the leaf round the potato roll.
5. Repeat the same procedure for the remaining filling and spinach leaves.
6. Combine the Ingredients for the batter.
7. Dip the rolls in this batter and deep fry in oil.
8. Ready to serve hot with tomato ketchup
Vegetable Noodles

Noodles - 1 pack
Soy Sauce - 2 Tea Spoon
Ginger - 1″ Inch piece (Finely Chopped)
Garlic - 4 cloves (Finely Chopped)
Coriander leaves - 1 Table Spoon (Finely Chopped)
Onion - 1 (Finely Chopped)
Mixed Vegetable - 1 Cup
Pepper - 1 Tea Spoon
Salt - Needed Qty
Tomato sauce - 1 Tea Spoon

1. Cook noodles and keep aside.
2. Heat oil in a pan; add ginger, garlic and onion. Saute till onion turns golden brown.
3. Now, add vegetable, soy sauce, tomato sauce and pepper. Mix the ingredients together and half cook the vegetables on medium flame.
4. Then, add noodles, mix well.
5. Garnish with coriander and serve hot with tomato sauce.
Chicken Dumplings

Chicken-1cup{minced}
Sago-2cup (sabudhana /saggubiyam )
Peanut-1cup{rosted}
Palmsugar-1cup
Onions-3
Peppercorn-1tsp
Garlic-2pods
Coriander leaves-3ts
Fish sauce-3tsp
Oil-4tbsp
Salt to taste

1. Soak sago in warm water till soft, add salt and set aside.
2. Chop onion finely and Crush peanuts
3. Grind garlic, coriander leaves, peppercorns to a paste.
4. Heat oil in a pan and add ground paste and fry till smell arises.
5. Add onion and fry till it is brown.
6. Then add chicken and stir well.
7. When chicken is cooked, add peanuts, fish sauce, palm sugar and stir.
8. When contents are dry, switch off the stove.
9. When cool, roll into small balls.
10. Take a portion of sago and shape into a cup.
11. Place the chicken mix, cover and set aside.
12. Repeat the process.
13. Steam the dumplings.
Tasty Thai Fish Balls

Fish fillets-250 gms
Red Thai Curry Paste-1tsp
Fish sauce-1/2tbsp
Oil-4tbsp
Coriander leaves-1/2tbsp{chopped}
Salt to taste

1. Cut the fish fillets into small chunks.
2. Make the paste of fillets by processing in a food processor.
3. Add the curry paste, fish sauce and salt.
4. Blend the mixture for 30 seconds.
5. In a bowl, pu the mixture and fold in the coriander.
6. Roll out small balls and refrigerate for 25 minutes to set firm.
7. Heat oil in the pan, deep-fry the balls for 2 minutes and drain on a kitchen paper.
8. Stick a toothpick into each ball.
9. Serve the fish balls with sweet Thai chili sauce.
Chicken Stuffed Buns

Active dry yeast-1tbsp
Warm water-2tbsp
Vegetable oil-1/2cup
Milk-1/2cup
Maida-2 1/4cup
Egg-1{betan}
Sugar-2tbsp
Egg white-1
White sesam seeds for sprinkle
CHICKEN STUFFING:
Shredded Chicken-1 1/2cup{cooked}
Ginger garlic paste-1tsp
Corinder powder-1tsp
Red chilli powder-1tsp
Onion-1{chopped}
Cumin powder-one pinch
Coriander leaves-2tbsp
Garam masala powder-one pinch
Salt to taste

1. Dissolve the yeast in warm water with 1/2 tbsp sugar and 1/2 tbsp flour. Leave aside for 10 mts.
2. Boil the milk and cool till it is warm on touch. Add sugar, oil and salt.
3. Mix well with a wooden spoon till the sugar dissolves. Add 1 cup flour and mix to a smooth paste.
4. Add the beaten egg, yeast and mix. Add the remaining flour and mix well till it forms a smooth dough.
5. Knead well for 10 mts. Let it rest till it doubles in volume (approx an hour or two). While its resting prepare the chicken filling.
6. Punch down the dough lightly using your palm and divide the dough equally.
7. Flatten each portion and fill with 1 tbsp of the chicken filling. Re-shape into a smooth ball. Sprinkle the top with sesame seeds.
8. Let it sit/prove for another 20 mins.
9. Bake them in a pre-heated oven at 200 degrees C for 10-12 mts. When it starts to brown, brush tops with egg white.
10. Method for Chicken Filling – Heat oil in a heavy bottomed vessel, add the onions and saute for 4 mts. Add ginger garlic paste and saute for 4 mts.
11. Reduce the heat, add the red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder and garam masala powder and mix well.
12. Add the shredded chicken and mix well. Add salt to taste. Cook for 3 mts.
13. Turn off heat and cool. Add coriander leaves and mix.
Bread Pakoda

Bread Slices - 5
Gram Flour (Besan) - 1cup
turmeric powder - 1/4th Tea Spoon
Salt - to taste
Aijwain - 1/2 Tea Spoon
Red chili powder - to taste
Garam Masala powder - 1/4th Tea Spoon
Oil - for frying

1. Cut Bread slices into triangle shape pieces
2. Take a bowl and add gram flour salt, chili powder, Garam masala, Aijwain and mix it.
3. Add little water and make a smooth batter (neither too thick nor too loose)
4. Heat oil in a Kadai, dip bread piece in the batter and fry till crisp on medium flame
5. Now the tasty and crispy bread Pakoda is ready to serve.
6. Serve hot with green chutney or tomato sauce
Mushroom Basket

Bread slices - 6
Butter - 100 Grams
Onions - 2 ( finely chopped )
Pineapple slices - 10 Grams ( finely chopped )
Fresh mushrooms - 250 Grams (finely chopped) 
Salt and pepper - to tast
Milk - 150 ml
Fresh cream - 100 Grams
White sauce - 1/2 cup

1.Place two bread slices side by side on a greased baking tray.
2.Place two bread slices over each slice and press gently. Scoop out the centre soft portion of the two bread slices to make two boxes. Toast them till brown. Heat butter and fry the onion till translucent. Add pineapple and mushrooms.
3.Add salt, pepper and milk. Saute till done and dry. Remove from heat.
4.When cool, fold in the fresh cream and white sauce.
5.Pour the mixture into the bread boxes.
6.Bake in a hot oven for 10 minutes. Serve hot.
Chicken Tikkas

Tandoori Masala – 2 tsp
Yogurt – 1/2 cup
Lemon Juice – 1 tbsp
Red Chili Powder – to taste
Ginger and Garlic Paste – 4 tsp
Cumin Powder – 1 tsp
Coriander Powder – 1 tsp
Green Chilies – to taste, minced
Oil – 1 tbsp
Salt – to taste

1. Chicken – wash, clean and cut to bite size pieces.
2. Put the Chicken in a bowl and add lemon juice to it.
3. Allow it to rest for 5 minutes.
4. Mix the marinade ingredients in a zip lock. Mix well.
5. Check for salt and other spices.
6. Add Chicken to the marinade and mix well.
7. Let the Chicken marinate for 4-5 hours in the refrigerator.
8. Thread the Chicken on pre-soaked bamboo skewers.
9. Broil the Chicken in the oven on high.
10. Cook the Chicken for 10 minutes on each side and 7 minutes on the other or till the Chicken are slightly brown.
11. Once fully cooked, remove from the oven and garnish with onions and lemon wedges and serve with Mint Chutney.
Shammi Kebabs

Bread crumbs – as need for coating
Egg – 1,beaten
Red chilli oowder – 1 tsp
Cumin powder – 1 tsp
Coriander powder – 1 tsp
Garam masala – 1 tsp
Garlic – 1 inch
Onion – 1
Green chillies – 4
Garlic cloves – 3
Channa daal – 1/2 cup
Water – 3/4 cup
Meat – 500 gms {minced}
Salt to taste
Oil – for pan fry

1. In a pressure cooker, add in most of the above ingredients – Meat, Daal, Garlic, Ginger, Green Chili, Salt and Water.
2. Cook with the weight on high heat, allow it to whistle 1 time and then reduce the flame and cook for 25-30 minutes.
3. Let the mixture cool to room temperature.
4. Add in the Onions and grind well in a blender.
5. Avoid using water.
6. Add in the dry spices – Garam Masala, Coriander Powder, Cumin Powder and Red Chili Powder.
7. Mix well.
8. Add in the egg little at a time and mix.
9. Shape the mixture into desired size patties. (Store the mixture in the refrigerator for a couple of hours if the mixture is too soft to make kebabs.)
10. Heat some oil in a shallow skillet.
11. Pour Breadcrumbs into a shallow plate.
12. Roll the kebabs (patties) on the breadcrumbs.
13. Shallow fry kebabs in oil on both sides till golden-brown.
14. Serve with Imli (Tamarind), Mint or Green Chutney or good old ketchup.
15. Makes 8 –10 kebabs (depending on size)
Chocolate Fudge

Sweetened condensed milk - 1 tin
Butter - 1 1/2 Table Spoons
Creamy peanut butter - 1 1/2 Table Spoons
Grated chocolate - 2 1/2 cups

1. Heat a pan and add peanut, butter and 3 Table Spoons of condensed milk in it and stir to make a smooth creamy mixture.
2. Turn off the flame and allow to cool for few minutes.
3. Melt chocolate in a double boiler
4. At the same time heat a stainless steel vessel with some water and boil
5. Over the stainless steel vessel place another vessel as it rests on the rim of the lower vessel.
6. Place the grated chocolate in upper vessel and let it melt due to the steam released from the hot water.
7. Keep stirring till the chocolate melts completely 
8. Turn off the flame and remove the melted chocolate vessel and keep aside.
9. Take a baking pan, grease and line with butter paper such that the paper is longer than the pan.
10. Pour the creamy peanut butter mixture and spread all over to form a thin layer.
11. Use a flat spatula to spread it out evenly
12. Take another pan and add 1 ½ Table Spoons of butter and let it melt on low flame.
13. Add the remaining condensed milk and mix well.
14. Add the melted chocolate and keep stirring for 2-3 minutes and then turn off the flame
15. Over this layer, pour the chocolate mixture and allow it to spread all over the pan evenly using a spatula.
16. Let it cool before setting it in the refrigerator.
17. Cover the baking pan with a plastic wrap and set in refrigerator for 3-4 hours
18. After the fudge is set, remove from the fridge and lift carefully out of the baking pan and place it on a plate
19. Cut in to squares and store in an air tight container.
Paneer Onion Kachori

For the dough:
2 cups Maida (Plain Flour)
1/4 cup melted Ghee
1/2 tsp Sal
For filling:
2 cups finely chopped Onions
1 cup paneer finely chopped into small pieces
2 tsp Saunf (Fennel Seeds)
2 Bay Leaves
1/2 tsp finely chopped Green Chillies
2 tblsp Besan (Bengal Gram Flour)
2 tsp Dhania Powder (Coriander)
2 tsp Chilli Powder
1 tsp Garam Masala
3 tblsp Chopped Coriander
2 tblsp Oil
Salt to taste
Oil for frying

1 To prepare the dough combine all the ingredients in a bowl and knead into a semi soft dough using water. Keep it for 5 – 7 minutes.
2 Divide the dough into 12 equal parts and keep them covered under a wet muslin cloth. For the onion filling heat oil in a pan.
3 Add the saunf, bay leaves, green chillies and onions and saute till the onions turn light brownin color.
5 Add the besan, coriander powder, chilli powder, garam masala and salt and saute for 2-3 minutes.
6 Add the chopped coriander and mix well.
7 Remove the bay leaves.
8 Allow the mixture to cool completely. Add paneer.
9 Divide into 12 equal parts and keep aside.
10 To make kachoris roll out each portion of the dough into a 2 inch diameter circle.
11 Place one portion of the filling in the centre of the rolled dough.
12 Surround the filling with the dough by slowly streching it over the filling
13 Seal the ends tightly and remove excess dough.
14 Roll each filled portion into a 2 1/2 inch diameter circle taking care to ensure that the filling does not spill out.
15 Gently press the centre of the kachori with your thumb.
16 Deep fry the kachoris in hot oil over a slow flame till fgolden brown.
17 The kachoris should puff up like puris.
18 These kachoris take a long time to be cooked in the inside too.
19 Serve hot with Curd Chutney
Crispy Cheese Rolls

Bread slices - 8 
grated cheese - 2 tablespoons
milk - ½ cup
small onions - 2 (finely chopped)
green chillies - 2 (chopped fine)
ginger - 1 teaspoon (finely chopped )
coriander leaves - 1 tablespoon (finely chopped)
oil - for deep frying
salt - to taste

1. Take a bowl and mix the milk, grated cheese, chopped onions, green chillies, ginger, coriander leaves and salt in it.
2. Mix well and spoon the mixture on to each bread slice and roll it tight.
3. Heat the oil for deep frying on high flame.
4. Drop in the rolls slowly.
5. Reduce the heat and fry on medium flame stirring frequently till the rolls are crisp and light brown in color.
6. Drain on a paper towel and serve hot with green chutney or tomato ketchup
Sweet Corn Sandwich

Bread slices - 4
Boiled sweet corn - 1 cup
Onion - 1
Tomato - 1
Capsicum - ½
Butter - 1 Tea Spoon
Salt - to taste
Chat masala - a pinch
Chilli powder - a pinch
Pepper powder - a pinch
Mint leaves - few

1. Finely chop the onion, tomato and capsicum in to circles
2. Take the bread pieces in to the palm and apply butter to the slices
3. Arrange the sweet corn, chopped onion, tomato and capsicum circles on the top of the bread slices.
4. Now add salt, chilli powder, pepper powder, chat masala and mint leaves to the veggies on the bread slices
5. Now place another bread slice on the top of this bread slice and cover it
6. Now the tasty sweet corn sandwich is ready to eat.
7. Taste it by adding tomato sauce to it.
